fields.content:
Political Memory is a toolbox designed to help you reach members of European Parliament (MEPs), and track their voting records. We hope it will help citizens to get to better know their elected representatives, and to allow them to inform them on the issues covered by La Quadrature du Net.

This is version 2 of Political Memory is still in development. Don't hesitate to help us !

fields.header: Reach members of European Parliament and track their votes & opinions!

fields.content: This page allows you to browse MEPs sorted by their names.
This page allows you to browse MEPs sorted by their home Member States.

This page allows you to browse MEPs according to the political group they belong to in the EU Parliament. Every MEP belongs to a political group — they are not organised by nationality, but by political affiliation. There are currently 7 political groups in the European Parliament (souce)

This page allow you to browse MEPs according to the committee(s) they belong to. The committees of the EU Parliament draw up, amend and adopt legislative proposals and own-initiative reports. They consider EU Commission and ZU Council proposals and, where necessary, draw up reports to be presented to the plenary assembly. A committee consists of between 24 and 76 MEPs, and has a chair, a bureau and a secretariat. The political make-up of the committees reflects that of the plenary assembly (source).

This page allows you to browse MEPs according to the delegation they belong to. MEPs may take part in EU Parliament’s delegations on a voluntary basis. These delegations maintain and develop the European Parliament's international contacts, particularly relations with Parliaments in third countries (source).
